game.name: Brutal Doom
game.desc: Doom on Steroids! NOTE: Requires keyboard to exit!

game.name: The Ur-quan Masters
game.desc: n 1990, Toys for Bob released a simple multiplayer space battle game called Star Control. In 1992, it birthed a sequel, Star Control 2, an MS-DOS space exploration adventure of dizzying scope. Ten years later, the creators made the source code of the 3DO version available as open source. Another nine years passed, and the game was reborn as The Ur-Quan Masters, a non-commercial PC recreation of the original game for a new generation.

game.path: ./Solarus Engine - Zelda Mystery of Solarus DX.sh
game.name: Zelda Mystery of Solarus DX
game.desc:
The Legend of Zelda: Mystery of Solarus DX is set to be a direct sequel to The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past on the SNES, using the same graphics and game mechanisms. Zelda Mystery of Solarus DX is the first game made with the Solarus engine and in fact, Solarus was primarily designed for this game.
NOTE: Requires keyboard to exit!

game.path: ./Solarus Engine - Zelda Mystery of Solarus XD.sh
game.name: Zelda Mystery of Solarus XD
game.desc:
Zelda Mystery of Solarus XD is a parodic game that we released on April 1st, 2011. Though it's a big April 1st joke, it's a real, full game with two huge dungeons and 5-10 hours of playing.
NOTE: Requires keyboard to exit!

game.name: Quake Episode 5 (dopa)
game.desc: Quake expansion Episode 5 dopa! NOTE: Requires keyboard to exit!

game.path: ./Solarus Engine - Zelda Return of the Hylian SE.sh
game.name: Zelda Return of the Hylian SE
game.desc:
Zelda Return of the Hylian SE. Zelda Return of the Hylian Solarus Edition is a remake of the original Zelda Return of the Hylian, a short but pleasant fangame from Vincent Jouillat.
After Link's victory over Ganon (in "A Link to the Past"), no one knows what Link's wish to the Triforce was. But this wish reunified the Light World and the Dark World and brought the 7 wise men's descendants back to life. Peace was back in Hyrule. But unfortunately, this wish also resurrected Ganon .
NOTE: Requires keyboard to exit!

game.name: '☆Streets of Rage Remake 5.1
game.desc: Street of Rage Remake. Streets of Rage Remake (also known as Bare Knuckle Remake) is a mind-blowing SOR fangame, released by Bombergames in 2011 on the Microsoft Windows platform. It is designed as a remake of the original Sega Genesis trilogy, though in some ways it can be seen as a true sequel to SOR3.

game.name: Quake Mission Pack 1 (hipnotic)
game.desc: Quake Mission Pack 1 (hipnotic)! NOTE: Requires keyboard to exit!

game.name: Wolfenstein 3D Coop
game.desc: 4 player Wolfenstein 3D, custom mod with splitscreen support for pure coop fun. Aka Splitwolf - Wolfenstein ID Software First Person Shooter series originally developed for the PC by Id Software.

game.name: Quake Mission Pack 2 (rogue)
game.desc: Quake Mission Pack 2 (rogue)! NOTE: Requires keyboard to exit!

game.name: CannonBall: The Enhanced OutRun
game.desc: Cannonball is an enhanced version of Sega’s classic 1986 game Outrun available for Windows, Mac OS, Linux, Pandora and Android. Although it requires the same ROMs that popular arcade emulators use to play the game, this is no mere emulator. Cannonball is a complete re-write of the game engine which adds a variety of enhancements such as true widescreen support, high-resolution graphics with improved sprite scaling, several bug fixes, additional view modes and support for both analog and digital gamepads.

game.name: Cave Story
game.desc: Cave Story (doukutsu monogatari) is a Freeware Platform-Adventure Video Game Released in 2004 for the PC. It was developed over 5 years by Daisuke "Pixel" Amaya in his free time. It is one of the greatest most beautifully crafted games, particularly because of its compelling plot and musical genius.

game.name: Doom II
game.desc: Doom II original from PC edition!

game.name: Duke Nukem 3D
game.desc: Duke Nukem 3D is a First Person Shooter game developed by 3D Realms in 1996.

game.name: Super Mario War
game.desc: Super Mario War is an open-source, cross-platform, platform-adventure video game and level editor released on December 16, 2006. It is based upon gameplay elements and audiovisual media that are cloned from Nintendo's Super Mario series.

game.name: Wolfenstein 3D
game.desc:
Wolfenstein ID Software First Person Shooter series originally developed for the PC by Id Software.
The source code to the original Quake engine was released under the GPLv2 license on December 21st 1999. This has enabled a wide variety of source ports and improvements to be made and for the game to run on alternative operating systems and architectures.

game.name: C Dogs
game.desc: Open source, classic overhead run-and-gun game. Customize your player and choose from up to 11 weapons.

game.name: Commander Genius
game.desc:
Commander Keen was a video game series originally on DOS. By default the emulator comes with 3 Commander Keen games, follow the file format of the games that are there when adding new games. You can then select them from the Commander Genius Launch Menu.
The included games are: Episode 1: Marooned on Mars Episode 2: The Earth Explodes Episode 3: Keen Must Die!

game.name: Doom I
game.desc: The Ultimate Doom I edition!

game.name: Jazz Jackrabbit OpenJAZZ
game.desc: OpenJazz. is a free, open-source version of the classic Jazz Jackrabbit games. OpenJazz can compiled for RPI4 and looks great 1080p 3x scale, implemented and tested by VMAN!

game.name: Quake
game.desc:
Quake was a First Person Shooter series originally developed for the PC by Id Software. It is a successor to the Doom Series.
There are 4 Quake games: Quake, Quake II, and Quake III Arena and Quake 4. RetroPie includes Quake, TyrQuake (an optimized build of the original Quake Engine), and Quake III Arena.
The source code to the original Quake engine was released under the GPLv2 license on December 21st 1999. This has enabled a wide variety of source ports and improvements to be made and for the game to run on alternative operating systems and architectures.
